Parameter.Name: Port
Parameter.Description: Many programming blocks require that you select the ports on the EV3 Brick (A, B, C, D, 1, 2, 3, and 4) that these blocks will use. The Port Selectors are in the top right-hand corner of these blocks.

Parameter.Name: Comparison
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 - 5
Notes: 0: = (Equal to)
1: ≠ (Not Equal to)
2: > (Greater than)
3: ≥ (Greater than or Equal to)
4: < (Less than)
5: ≤ (Less than or Equal to)

Parameter.Name: Threshold
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: Any number
Notes: Value to compare sensor data to

Parameter.Name: Amount
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: Amount for sensor value to change in a Sensor Change Mode

Parameter.Name: signatureIn
Parameter.Description: Selects the signature or color code you'd like Pixy to search for.

Parameter.Name: colorCodeIn
Parameter.Description: Selects the signature or color code you'd like Pixy to search for.

Parameter.Name: xOut
Parameter.Description: Outputs the X location of the center of the largest object that Pixy has found. The number returned ranges from 0 to 255, with 0 being the rightmost pixel if facing the camera lens.

Parameter.Name: yOut
Parameter.Description: Outputs the Y location of the center of the largest object that Pixy found. The number returned is from 0 to 159, with 0 being the topmost pixel.

Parameter.Name: widthOut
Parameter.Description: Outputs the width of the largest block that Pixy has found. The number returned is from 1 to 256.

Parameter.Name: heightOut
Parameter.Description: Outputs the height of the largest block that Pixy has found. The number returned is from 1 to 256.

Parameter.Name: nMatches
Parameter.Description: The number of blocks found by Pixy matching Signature or Color Code.

Parameter.Name: signatureOut
Parameter.Description: Outputs the number of blocks that match the signature or color code you specified in the Signature input. Or it outputs the signature number of the detected object if in General Mode (see the description of modes below).

Parameter.Name: angleOut
Parameter.Description: Is the angle (in degrees) of the largest object that Pixy has found. Angle information is only available for color codes, otherwise the value is 0.

Parameter.Name: Result
Parameter.Description:
Type: Logic
Notes: True/False result of a Compare mode.

Block.Description: Requests that Pixy search for the signature requested in Signature input. Returns information about the largest block matching the signature found by Pixy.
Requests that Pixy search for the color code requested in Color Code input. Returns information about the largest block matching the color code found by Pixy.
Compares the number of signatures found by Pixy matching the Signature input.
Waits for the number of signatures found by Pixy to change by Amount.
Waits for the number of signatures found by Pixy to change by Amount.
Waits for the number of signatures found by Pixy to change by Amount.
Loops until the number of signatures found by Pixy to changes by Amount.
Selects between the number of signatures found by Pixy.

Parameter.Name: valueIn
Parameter.Description: The input for the measured value. For Pixy, you would typically input the X or Y outputs, but really any measured value can go here, even from sensors other than Pixy, like the IR proximity sensor.

Parameter.Name: Instance
Parameter.Description: The instance of the PID block. Up to 8 instances of the PID block can be used independently in the same program. If you need more than one PID block, be sure to give them different instances.

Parameter.Name: controlOut
Parameter.Description: The output of the controller. This is typically connected to your “action”, which is almost always one or more motors (for LEGO Mindstorms). You could (in theory) connect this to your furnace if you wanted to build a home thermostat, and you had a temperature sensor connected to Value In, but that’s a project for another day!

Parameter.Name: setPoint
Parameter.Description: The “desired value”. In other words you want to “drive” the sensor value (Value In) to this value.

Parameter.Name: pidP
Parameter.Description: The proportional gain input.

Parameter.Name: pidI
Parameter.Description: The integral gain input.

Parameter.Name: pidD
Parameter.Description: The derivative gain input.

Parameter.Name: iMultiplier
Parameter.Description: A multiplier for the final output. It is especially useful if you need to invert the output (you do so by setting to -1). This value is 1 by default.

Block.Description: A simple PID controller. Assumes a constant loop rate and uses a summation to represent the integral. Uses local memory for each instance of the PID controller.
